title: Nahum Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Nahum with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 3 chapters.

questions.question: What is the burden of Nahum primarily concerning?
questions.explanation: The book of Nahum is a prophecy concerning the city of Nineveh.

questions.question: According to Nahum 1:2, how is the LORD described in relation to His enemies?
questions.explanation: The LORD is jealous and takes vengeance on His adversaries.

questions.question: Nahum 1:3 states the LORD has His way in which natural phenomena?
questions.explanation: The LORD controls the whirlwind and storm as part of His power.

questions.question: What effect does the LORD have on the sea and rivers according to Nahum 1:4?
options: He rebukes and dries them up
He parts them like in Exodus
questions.correctAnswer: He rebukes and dries them up
questions.explanation: God rebukes the sea and dries up all rivers.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 1:5 says the mountains quake and the hills melt at the presence of the LORD.
questions.explanation: The verse describes the earth trembling before God’s presence.

questions.question: Who can stand before the indignation of the LORD as described in Nahum 1:6?
questions.explanation: No one can stand before God's fierce anger.

questions.question: According to Nahum 1:7, what does the LORD provide to those who trust in Him?
options: A stronghold in the day of trouble
questions.correctAnswer: A stronghold in the day of trouble
questions.explanation: God is a refuge for those who trust Him.

questions.question: What will happen to the enemies of the LORD according to Nahum 1:8?
options: They will be pursued by darkness and destroyed by a flood
They will be given a second chance
questions.correctAnswer: They will be pursued by darkness and destroyed by a flood
questions.explanation: God will make an utter end of His enemies with an overrunning flood.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 1:9 declares that affliction shall rise up a second time against the LORD's people.
questions.explanation: It states affliction shall not rise up the second time.

questions.question: In Nahum 1:11, who is described as a 'wicked counsellor' imagining evil against the LORD?
questions.explanation: This refers to an individual from Nineveh opposing the LORD.

questions.question: What promise does the LORD make about the affliction of His people in Nahum 1:12?
options: He will not afflict them anymore
He will send another affliction soon
questions.correctAnswer: He will not afflict them anymore
questions.explanation: Though He has afflicted them, He promises to afflict them no more.

questions.question: According to Nahum 1:13, what will the LORD do to the yoke of Nineveh?
questions.explanation: God will break the yoke from off Nineveh and burst its bonds.

questions.question: Nahum 1:14 speaks of cutting off what from the house of gods in Nineveh?
questions.explanation: The LORD commands to cut off idols from the house of their gods.

questions.question: What does Nahum 1:15 say the feet upon the mountains bring?
questions.explanation: The verse speaks of feet bringing good news and publishing peace.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 2:1 commands to keep the munition and fortify power mightily because a breaker has come up before the face of Nineveh.
questions.explanation: The verse instructs to prepare defenses against an approaching enemy.

questions.question: In Nahum 2:2, the LORD has turned away the excellency of which people?
questions.explanation: The excellency of Jacob and Israel is turned away by the LORD.

questions.question: What color are the shields and garments of the mighty men described in Nahum 2:3?
questions.explanation: Their shields are red and their garments scarlet.

questions.question: According to Nahum 2:4, how do the chariots move in the streets?
options: They rage and justle one against another
They come in a perfect line
questions.correctAnswer: They rage and justle one against another
questions.explanation: The chariots rage and collide in the streets.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 2:6 says the gates of the rivers shall be closed to protect the palace.
questions.explanation: The gates of the rivers shall be opened and the palace dissolved.

questions.question: Who is led away captive as mentioned in Nahum 2:7?
questions.explanation: Huzzab is led away captive with her maids.

questions.question: How is Nineveh described in Nahum 2:8?
questions.explanation: Nineveh is described as being like an old pool of water.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 2:10 says the heart melts and knees smite together upon seeing Nineveh's destruction.
questions.explanation: The verse describes intense fear and distress.

questions.question: Where is the dwelling of the lions mentioned in Nahum 2:11?
questions.explanation: The verse speaks about the dwelling place of lions in Nineveh.

questions.question: What will happen to the chariots and young lions according to Nahum 2:13?
options: They will be burned and cut off
questions.correctAnswer: They will be burned and cut off
questions.explanation: God declares He will burn chariots and devour young lions.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of ______ and robbery.'
questions.explanation: Nahum 3:1 describes the city as full of lies and robbery.

questions.question: What noises are heard in Nahum 3:2 describing the coming destruction?
options: Whip, rattling wheels, prancing horses, jumping chariots
questions.correctAnswer: Whip, rattling wheels, prancing horses, jumping chariots
questions.explanation: These sounds describe the invasion and destruction of the city.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 3:4 calls Nineveh a mistress of witchcrafts who sells nations through her whoredoms.
questions.explanation: The city is described as a harlot practicing witchcraft.

questions.question: What will the LORD do to Nineveh's skirts according to Nahum 3:5?
questions.explanation: God says He will expose her shame to the nations.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And I will cast abominable ______ upon thee, and make thee vile.'
questions.explanation: The LORD will cast abominable filth upon Nineveh.

questions.question: Who will flee from Nineveh as it is laid waste according to Nahum 3:7?
questions.explanation: Everyone who sees the destruction will flee and say Nineveh is laid waste.

questions.question: Which city is compared to Nineveh in Nahum 3:8?
questions.explanation: Nineveh is compared to populous No, situated among rivers.

questions.question: Which nations were helpers to Nineveh as per Nahum 3:9?
questions.explanation: These nations were considered Nineveh’s strength and helpers.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 3:10 mentions that Nineveh’s young children were dashed in pieces at the top of the streets.
questions.explanation: The verse describes brutal destruction including the death of children.

questions.question: According to Nahum 3:11, what will happen to Nineveh’s strength?
options: It will be hidden and she will seek strength
questions.correctAnswer: It will be hidden and she will seek strength
questions.explanation: Nineveh will be drunken and seek strength because of the enemy.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'All thy strong holds shall be like fig trees with the ______ figs.'
questions.explanation: The verse uses the image of fig trees with firstripe figs to describe Nineveh's strongholds.

questions.question: What is said about the people in Nahum 3:13?
options: They are women and the gates are open to enemies
They are warriors defending the city
questions.correctAnswer: They are women and the gates are open to enemies
questions.explanation: The people are described as women and the gates are wide open to enemies.

questions.question: What materials are commanded to be drawn and prepared for the siege in Nahum 3:14?
questions.explanation: The city is told to draw water, go into clay, tread mortar, and make strong the brickkiln.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 3:15 uses the cankerworm and locust as symbols for the many enemies attacking Nineveh.
questions.explanation: The verse compares the attackers to numerous insects devouring the city.

questions.question: According to Nahum 3:16, what has Nineveh multiplied above the stars of heaven?
questions.explanation: Nineveh's merchants are said to be multiplied above the stars of heaven.

questions.question: How are the crowned and captains of Nineveh described in Nahum 3:17?
questions.explanation: The kings and captains are compared to swarming insects.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 3:18 says the shepherds (leaders) of Nineveh are alert and vigilant.
questions.explanation: They are described as slumbering and the nobles dwelling in the dust.

questions.question: What does Nahum 3:19 say about the bruise and wound of Nineveh?
options: There is no healing; the wound is grievous
The bruise is minor and temporary
The wound is self-inflicted and forgiven
questions.correctAnswer: There is no healing; the wound is grievous
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes the permanent and grievous nature of Nineveh's wound.

questions.question: Which chapter of Nahum contains the description of God being slow to anger and great in power?
questions.explanation: Nahum 1:3 describes God as slow to anger and great in power.

questions.question: True or False: Nahum 2 describes the gates of the rivers as being opened, signaling the fall of Nineveh’s palace.
questions.explanation: Nahum 2:6 states the gates of the rivers shall be opened and the palace shall be dissolved.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his holes with prey, and his dens with ______.'
questions.explanation: Nahum 2:12 uses the word 'ravin' to describe the lion’s spoils.
